attributes.action: Replace and up grade the water main supply to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 the main burst leaving the whole island without water for 2 days, this has now happened again in 2022 one burst was fixed this caused a second burst . the second burst was fixed and this caused more problems. They then had to shut the A 249 main road onto the island in order to install emergence pumps. They have done this in rush hour causing major traffic jams, we have had no water now for 2 days and no sign of getting any. and all this during a massive heat wave.
attributes.background: insist that Southern water replace and upgrade the water main supply to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent due to the poor state of the existing pipe

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about maintenance of water supply are a matter for individual water suppliers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you are unhappy with your water supplier you can find out how to complain about this here: https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/regulated-companies/investigations/making-a-complaint/
